Watch our video series discussing the impact an abortion ban would have on women's healthcare.
 ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌

Dear ##SM_RULE_360 Email Salutation##,

I am happy to announce that we have just released our original video series "Stop. The. Bans. American Physicians Speak Out," that discusses the impact an abortion ban would have on women's healthcare.

The series includes 19 physicians from diverse disciplines: obstetrics and gynecology, cardiology, emergency medicine, family medicine, psychiatry, psychology, internal medicine, maternal fetal medicine, and oncology.

The first set of videos are now on our website. You'll see a new one posted on our social media each evening. The videos are also subtitled in Spanish and can be found at acluga.org/medicos.

Watch the first video we released on social media: 1 out of 4 women will have an abortion.

Since the Georgia legislature passed the abortion ban, we have received questions about what it means for women's healthcare. We went to the experts – American physicians who provide healthcare for women.

We asked physicians in a number of different disciplines out of the awareness that the effect of this law went far beyond limiting or eliminating access to abortion care, as detrimental as that would be by itself. This law has even greater implications for women to access to healthcare, period. Our message is clear: Let her decide.

Please watch the video and share it on social media with the hashtags #LetHerDecide and #StopTheBans or in Spanish #DÃ©jalaDecidir and #AltoalosProhibiciones.

Thank you for all that you are doing to help us Stop. The. Bans.

For Justice,

Andrea Young
Executive Director, ACLU of Georgia
